fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:description: Audio bitstream produced by the Windows Media 9 professional audio codec.
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:shortDescription: Audio bitstream produced by the Windows Media 9 professional audio codec.
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:productionPhase: Generally used in files that represent a final-state format for end-user delivery.

fdd:relatedTo.fdd:titleName: Windows Media Audio file with WMA9_PRO codec

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:adoption: Extent of adoption is not known. ; the WMA file format is widely adopted.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:licensingAndPatents: See ASF for link to pages covering licensing of Windows Media and the Advanced Systems Format.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:transparency: Depends upon algorithms and tools to read; will require sophistication to build tools.

fdd:soundQF.fdd:fidelity: Better fidelity than WMA_WMA9, not as good as WMA_WMA9_LL. From the codecs page at the Microsoft Windows Media web site (consulted September 7, 2010): "This codec captures full-resolution 24-bit/96-kilohertz (kHz) audio . . . for streaming or download-and-play delivery at 128 to 768 Kbps." This codec supports variable bit rate coding that enables higher quality at smaller file sizes.
fdd:soundQF.fdd:channels: From the codecs page at the Microsoft Windows Media web site(consulted September 7, 2010): "For use in scenarios that require digital surround-sound. This codec captures audio in stereo or 5.1 channel (or even 7.1) surround . . . ."
